turns.utterance: Hey, I'm planning to participate in my first hackathon next month and I'm kinda stuck on finding a team. Any tips?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's great you're joining a hackathon! Finding a team is a common step. I recommend checking the official event forum or communication channels like Discord or Slack. Organizers often have specific threads for team formation. You can also network during pre-event mixers if available.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand that can feel discouraging. Don't worry, teams are forming right up until the start. You could try posting your own profile detailing your skills and what you're looking for in a team. Sometimes teams are looking for a specific skill to complete their group. Keep an eye out for announcements from the organizers regarding incomplete teams.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Teams often benefit from diverse skill sets beyond just coding, including design, project management, and presentation skills. If a team description seems interesting but isn't explicit about needing a UI/UX designer, the best approach is often to reach out directly and inquire about their needs and if a design role is something they are looking to fill.
